intro: Bolboschoenus maritimus f. zapalowiczii, commonly known as the Zapalowiczii form of the marsh sedge, is a variant of a perennial herbaceous plant native to coastal and wetland regions. It features narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically green to bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with inconspicuous flowers, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in brackish or saline environments, often found in tidal marshes and estuaries. Its botanical significance lies in its adaptation to coastal conditions and its role in stabilizing shorelines.
